title: Textile, late 20th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: plain weave patterned with hand drawn starch resist, indigo dyed (adire)
Label: cotton patterned with resist paste and indigo dyed (adire)
dimensions: H x W (seamed in middle): 196.2 x 175 cm (77 1/4 x 68 7/8 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description: Adire textile with a checkerboard of rectangles, each filled with pattern reserved in white on a deep indigo blue ground. The patterns include checkerboards, lattices, herringbones, pinwheels, trees, flowers and leaves, and other unidentifiable figural forms. The textile is composed of two widths of fabric stitched together in the center; the two pieces are identical in their patterning, but have been arranged in opposite orientations.
